alert.note: Alert for Coconino (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 29 at 3:17PM MST until July 29 at 5:45PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of north central Arizona and west central Arizona, including the following counties, in north central Arizona, Coconino. In west central Arizona, Yavapai. * WHEN...Until 400 PM MST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in creeks and normally dry washes is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 317 PM MST, Heavy rain has ended across the area of Williams and Ash Fork. Lighter showers will continue through 4:00 PM before ending. Be on the lookout for flooded low water crossings and ponding of water on roadways. - This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Dogtown Wash, Johnson Creek, West Cataract Creek, Sycamore Creek, Partridge Creek, Ash Fork Draw, Cataract Creek, Meath Wash and Hell Canyon. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Williams and Ash Fork. - This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 between mile markers 146 and 164. Business Interstate 40 between mile markers 146 and 164. State Route 89 between mile markers 358 and 363. - Visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for more information on flood safety.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
